revisions.rev:
{{Primary sources|date=October 2011}} {{Infobox software | name = Winetricks | title = Winetricks | logo = | screenshot = <!-- [[File: ]] --> | caption = | collapsible = | author = | developer = Dan Kegel | released = <!-- {{Start date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | discontinued = | latest release version = | latest release date = {{Start date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = <!-- {{Start date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | frequently updated = | programming language = | operating system = [[Linux]] | platform = | size = | language = | status = | genre = | license = | website = http://winetricks.org/ }} '''Winetricks''' is a [[script (computing)|script]] to install some basic components (typically Microsoft [[Dynamic-link library|DLLs]] and fonts) and tweak settings required for some applications to run correctly under [[Wine (software)|Wine]]. It can fully automate the install of a number of apps and games, including applying any needed workarounds. Winetricks is maintained by Wine developer Dan Kegel. The Wine project will accept certain types of bug reports for users of Winetricks, unlike most other third-party applications.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://wiki.winehq.org/winetricks#winetricks_and_bugs | title=winetricks | publisher=Official Wine Wiki | accessdate=3 January 2009}}</ref> [[File:Pegasus Mail Wine.png|thumb|right|[[Pegasus Mail]] running via Wine, version 1.1.42. (The [[Font rasterization|font smoothing]] is enabled by using [http://wiki.winehq.org/winetricks winetricks]. You can see the smooth fonts in the picture when it's viewed at full size.)]] Winetricks has a [[Graphical user interface|GUI]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://wiki.winehq.org/winetricks |title=winetricks - The Official Wine Wiki |author=VitalyLipatov |date=2011-03-30 |accessdate=2 August 2011}}</ref>
